title: ClickJacking
content:
I have found the vulnerability called Clickjacking.
Please find the details below:
Description
Clickjacking is an exploit in which malicious coding is hidden beneath apparently legitimate buttons or other clickable content on a website.
OWASP Benchmark A6- Security Misconfiguration
Steps to Reproduce
1.Craft an HTML page and add the following
( https://www.acronis.com/en-in/ ) of the application within an iframe.
2.Save the file as *.html and run the file.
3.Open the HTML page in a browser.
4.The following attached screenshot shows webiste is in frame.
Please find the attached screenshot for your reference.
High Level Fix Recommendation
Clickjacking attacks can be avoided by setting the X-Frame-Options header or by using frame busting code which check if the current web page is the top web page (not within a frame).
Impact
Impact
Multitude of attacks including key logging and stealing user credentials.
steps: Craft an HTML page and embed the target website (https://www.acronis.com/en-in/) within an iframe.
Save the file as *.html, open it in a browser, and observe the target website loading within the frame.
vuln_description: Clickjacking is an exploit where malicious content is hidden beneath legitimate clickable elements on a website, allowing attackers to trick users into performing unintended actions. The vulnerability occurs when the target website does not implement X-Frame-Options headers or frame-busting scripts to prevent being embedded in an iframe.
reason: The attack involves a straightforward process of embedding a website in an iframe and does not require complex interactions, multiple components, or novel logic. The vulnerability is easily reproducible with basic web development knowledge.
